page.title: 13EQUESTRIAN LIFE-ASTERBY AREA
page.content: The Scamblesby-Asterby area is well situated from the horse-person's view- point.The roads have grass verges,good for riding,and there are grass lanes within reach.Several families keep horses,mostly for fox-hunting although there are hacks & driving ponies used all the year round.At Asterby,there is an{Equestrian Centre}where lessons in all branches of horsemanship can be learned.{Race horses}are bred at near- by Cawkwell,and there is a flourishing stud for Thoroughbreds on the outskirts of the village.There is an active branch of {The British Horse {Society}at the Equestrian Centre,which covers all aspects of equestrian activities.{The Pony Club }is well supported at rallies and camps.There are now a few Show Ponies in the area. The {South Wold Hunt Kennels}are only three miles away,near Belchford.
